newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Printrak cut to buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Printrak cut to buy.

text.p: -- Cowen & Co analyst Rob Stone said he downgraded Printrak International Inc, which makes automated fingerprint ID systems, to buy from strong buy on price.
-- also said there "some near-term issues" on pending acquisition of TFP Inc, which supplies digital mug shot systems used by law enforcement, jail and corrections agencies.
-- kept earnings estimate of $0.67 per share for the 1997 fiscal year, ending in March, and introduced estimate of $0.80 for 1998.
-- said the acquisition will lead to some overlap in product lines, and "raises the question of how much incremental revenues (the deal) produces."

-- said still "very bullish on the strategic value of the merger long term. It's going to help Printrak accelerate the move toward PC and windows NT-based platforms. It's the wave of future, the wave of now."
